column4: 64-bit supprts 4GB of RAM and more, but some packages lach 64-bit versions and Flash 64-bit is an experimental stuff (or something like that).

64-bit versions of apps sometimes might be significantly faster. But because of the Flash, the 32-bit is the recommended version. Also, there are 32-bit kernels with PAE, to overcome the memory adressing limitations of 32-bit. Though, there might still be a 3GB+ limit of memory for a single process, but I'm not sure about it.
